url.text: CHARLOTTE, N.C., March 16, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- Regis Repko, Duke Energy's senior vice president of nuclear governance, projects and engineering, has been named the company's senior vice president and chief fossil/hydro officer, effective April 1, 2016. Repko succeeds Charlie Gates, who announced his retirement earlier this month. ...
url.title: Repko to lead Duke Energy's fossil/hydro organization

url.text: NEW YORK, March 11, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- S&P 500 constituents Danaher Corp. (DHR), Duke Energy Corp. (DUK) and NextEra Energy Inc. (NEE) will replace S&P 500 constituents Devon Energy Corp. (DVN), Anadarko Petroleum Corp. (APC) and Norfolk Southern Corp. (NSC) in the S&P 100 after the close of trading on Friday, March 18. All companies being removed from the S&P 100 will remain in the S&P 500. ...
url.title: Danaher, Duke Energy and NextEra Energy Set to Join the S&P 100

url.text: March 15--The chamber at the Boiling Springs Town Hall was packed with county residents on Monday night ready to speak and listen about coal ash basins at Duke Energy'sRogers Energy Complex/Cliffside Steam Station. The public meeting at Boiling Springs Town Hall on Monday evening was held to allow residents to provide feedback on the North Carolina Department of Environmental Quality's proposed risk classifications for the three coal ash basins. ...
url.title: Duke Energy : County residents weigh in on Cliffside station | 4-Traders

url.text:
Duke Energy has put battery and ultra-capacitor system to test at its Rankin Substation in Gaston County, North Carolina, US. 
The new hybrid ultracapacitor-battery energy storage system (HESS) will demonstrate various service applications such as load shifting, extended operational life, real-time solar smoothing and extended shelf-life. Duke Energy technology development manager Thomas Golden said: "This approach will allow our energy storage systems to do a variety of tasks. ...
url.title: Duke Energy tests new battery and ultracapacitor system at North Carolina substation

url.text: CHARLOTTE, N.C., March 14, 2016 /PRNewswire/ -- Piedmont Natural Gas (NYSE:  PNY) today received approval from the Tennessee Regulatory Authority (TRA) for a change in control to Duke Energy once the North Carolina Utilities Commission (NCUC) approves the transaction and the acquisition is completed.  The two energy companies first announced the proposed acquisition in October, 2015 and expect to close on the transaction by the end of 2016.  The TRA's action is a necessary step for the operational handoff from Piedmont to Duke Energy to occur in Tennessee once the acquisition is completed. It is the latest in a series of approvals and regulatory orders that Piedmont and Duke Energy have obtained with respect to the proposed acquisition. ...
url.title: Piedmont Natural Gas Receives Tennessee Regulatory Authority Approval for a Change in Control upon Acquisition by Duke Energy

url.text:
Wedbush Securities Inc. boosted its stake in shares of  Duke Energy Corp (NYSE:DUK) by 6.1% during the fourth quarter, according to its most recent filing with the SEC. The firm owned 16,898 shares of the company’s stock after buying an additional 974 shares during the period. Wedbush Securities Inc.’s holdings in Duke Energy Corp were worth $1,206,000 as of its most recent filing with the SEC. 
A number of other institutional investors also recently made changes to their positions in the company. ...
url.title: Duke Energy Corp (DUK) Stake Increased by Wedbush Securities Inc.
